docs.title: dwi2response
docs.description:
Estimate response function(s) for spherical deconvolution.
dwi2response offers different algorithms for performing various types of response function estimation. The name of the algorithm must appear as the first argument on the command-line after â€˜dwi2responseâ€™. The subsequent arguments and options depend on the particular algorithm being invoked.
Each algorithm available has its own help page, including necessary references; e.g. to see the help page of the 'fa' algorithm, type 'dwi2response fa'.

docs.title: algorithm
docs.description: Select the algorithm to be used to complete the script operation; additional details and options become available once an algorithm is nominated. Options are: dhollander, fa, manual, msmt_5tt, tax, tournier.

docs.title: out_sfwm
docs.description: Output single-fibre WM response function text file

docs.title: out_gm
docs.description: Output GM response function text file

docs.title: out_csf
docs.description: Output CSF response function text file

docs.title: dhollander
docs.description:
Unsupervised estimation of WM, GM and CSF response functions that does not require a T1 image (or segmentation thereof).
This is an improved version of the Dhollander et al. (2016) algorithm for unsupervised estimation of WM, GM and CSF response functions, which includes the Dhollander et al. (2019) improvements for single-fibre WM response function estimation (prior to this update, the "dwi2response tournier" algorithm had been utilised specifically for the single-fibre WM response function estimation step).

docs.title: input
docs.description: Input DWI dataset

docs.title: out_sfwm
docs.description: Output single-fibre WM response function text file

docs.title: out_gm
docs.description: Output GM response function text file

docs.title: out_csf
docs.description: Output CSF response function text file

docs.title: erode
docs.description: Number of erosion passes to apply to initial (whole brain) mask. Set to 0 to not erode the brain mask. (default: 3)

docs.title: fa
docs.description: FA threshold for crude WM versus GM-CSF separation. (default: 0.2)

docs.title: sfwm
docs.description: Final number of single-fibre WM voxels to select, as a percentage of refined WM. (default: 0.5 per cent)

docs.title: gm
docs.description: Final number of GM voxels to select, as a percentage of refined GM. (default: 2 per cent)

docs.title: csf
docs.description: Final number of CSF voxels to select, as a percentage of refined CSF. (default: 10 per cent)

docs.title: wm_algo
docs.description: Use external dwi2response algorithm for WM single-fibre voxel selection (options: fa, tax, tournier) (default: built-in Dhollander 2019)

docs.title: dhollander
docs.description:
Unsupervised estimation of WM, GM and CSF response functions that does not require a T1 image (or segmentation thereof).
This is an improved version of the Dhollander et al. (2016) algorithm for unsupervised estimation of WM, GM and CSF response functions, which includes the Dhollander et al. (2019) improvements for single-fibre WM response function estimation (prior to this update, the "dwi2response tournier" algorithm had been utilised specifically for the single-fibre WM response function estimation step).

docs.title: output
docs.description: The output response function text file

docs.title: fa
docs.description: Use the old FA-threshold heuristic for single-fibre voxel selection and response function estimation.

docs.title: input
docs.description: The input DWI

docs.title: output
docs.description: The output response function text file

docs.title: erode
docs.description: Number of brain mask erosion steps to apply prior to threshold (not used if mask is provided manually)

docs.title: number
docs.description: The number of highest-FA voxels to use

docs.title: threshold
docs.description: Apply a hard FA threshold, rather than selecting the top voxels

docs.title: fa
docs.description: Use the old FA-threshold heuristic for single-fibre voxel selection and response function estimation.

docs.title: output
docs.description: Output response function text file

docs.title: manual
docs.description: Derive a response function using an input mask image alone (i.e. pre-selected voxels).

docs.title: input
docs.description: The input DWI

docs.title: in_voxels
docs.description: Input voxel selection mask

docs.title: output
docs.description: Output response function text file

docs.title: dirs
docs.description: Manually provide the fibre direction in each voxel (a tensor fit will be used otherwise)

docs.title: manual
docs.description: Derive a response function using an input mask image alone (i.e. pre-selected voxels).

docs.title: out_wm
docs.description: Output WM response text file

docs.title: out_gm
docs.description: Output GM response text file

docs.title: out_csf
docs.description: Output CSF response text file

docs.title: msmt_5tt
docs.description: Derive MSMT-CSD tissue response functions based on a co-registered five-tissue-type (5TT) image

docs.title: input
docs.description: The input DWI

docs.title: in_5tt
docs.description: Input co-registered 5TT image

docs.title: out_wm
docs.description: Output WM response text file

docs.title: out_gm
docs.description: Output GM response text file

docs.title: out_csf
docs.description: Output CSF response text file

docs.title: dirs
docs.description: Manually provide the fibre direction in each voxel (a tensor fit will be used otherwise)

docs.title: fa
docs.description: Upper fractional anisotropy threshold for GM and CSF voxel selection (default: 0.2)

docs.title: pvf
docs.description: Partial volume fraction threshold for tissue voxel selection (default: 0.95)

docs.title: wm_algo
docs.description: algorithm dwi2response algorithm to use for WM single-fibre voxel selection (options: fa, tax, tournier; default: tournier)

docs.title: sfwm_fa_threshold
docs.description: Sets -wm_algo to fa and allows to specify a hard FA threshold for single-fibre WM voxels, which is passed to the -threshold option of the fa algorithm (warning: overrides -wm_algo option)

docs.title: msmt_5tt
docs.description: Derive MSMT-CSD tissue response functions based on a co-registered five-tissue-type (5TT) image

docs.title: output
docs.description: The output response function text file

docs.title: tax
docs.description: Use the Tax et al. (2014) recursive calibration algorithm for single-fibre voxel selection and response function estimation.

docs.title: input
docs.description: The input DWI

docs.title: output
docs.description: The output response function text file

docs.title: peak_ratio
docs.description: Second-to-first-peak amplitude ratio threshold

docs.title: max_iters
docs.description: Maximum number of iterations

docs.title: convergence
docs.description: Percentile change in any RF coefficient required to continue iterating

docs.title: tax
docs.description: Use the Tax et al. (2014) recursive calibration algorithm for single-fibre voxel selection and response function estimation.

docs.title: output
docs.description: The output response function text file

docs.title: tournier
docs.description: Use the Tournier et al. (2013) iterative algorithm for single-fibre voxel selection and response function estimation.

docs.title: input
docs.description: The input DWI

docs.title: output
docs.description: The output response function text file

docs.title: number
docs.description: Number of single-fibre voxels to use when calculating response function

docs.title: iter_voxels
docs.description: Number of single-fibre voxels to select when preparing for the next iteration (default = 10 x value given in -number)

docs.title: dilate
docs.description: Number of mask dilation steps to apply when deriving voxel mask to test in the next iteration

docs.title: max_iters
docs.description: Maximum number of iterations

docs.title: tournier
docs.description: Use the Tournier et al. (2013) iterative algorithm for single-fibre voxel selection and response function estimation.

docs.title: grad
docs.description: Provide the diffusion gradient table in MRtrix format

docs.title: fslgrad
docs.description: Provide the diffusion gradient table in FSL bvecs/bvals format

docs.title: bvecs
docs.description: Provide the diffusion-weighted gradient scheme used in the acquisition in FSL bvecs/bvals format files. If a diffusion gradient scheme is present in the input image header, the data provided with this option will be instead used.

docs.title: bvals
docs.description: Provide the diffusion-weighted gradient scheme used in the acquisition in FSL bvecs/bvals format files. If a diffusion gradient scheme is present in the input image header, the data provided with this option will be instead used.

docs.title: fslgrad
docs.description: Provide the diffusion-weighted gradient scheme used in the acquisition in FSL bvecs/bvals format files. If a diffusion gradient scheme is present in the input image header, the data provided with this option will be instead used.

docs.title: mask
docs.description: Only process voxels within the specified binary brain mask image.

docs.title: voxels
docs.description: Output an image showing the final voxel selection(s)

docs.title: shells
docs.description: b-value(s) to use in response function estimation (comma-separated list in case of multiple b-values, b=0 must be included explicitly)

docs.title: lmax
docs.description: maximum harmonic degree(s) for response function estimation (comma-separated list in case of multiple b-values).

docs.title: nocleanup
docs.description: do not delete intermediate files during script execution, and do not delete scratch directory at script completion.

docs.title: scratch
docs.description: manually specify the path in which to generate the scratch directory.

docs.title: continue
docs.description: continue the script from a previous execution; must provide the scratch directory path, and the name of the last successfully-generated file.

docs.title: info
docs.description: display information messages.

docs.title: quiet
docs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

docs.title: debug
docs.description: display debugging messages.

docs.title: force
docs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

docs.title: nthreads
docs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

docs.title: config
docs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

docs.title: key
docs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

docs.title: value
docs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

docs.title: config
docs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

docs.title: help
docs.description: display this information page and exit.

docs.title: version
docs.description: display version information and exit.
